projectDesc: KoKu! or Kantin Online Ku, is a web-based app that i build using Vue.JS, Laravel and TailwindCSS. This project's theme, as its name suggest, is Online School Canteen. I made this project for my school's final assignment.

techStack.techDesc: Vue (pronounced /vjuː/, like view) is a JavaScript framework for building user interfaces. It builds on top of standard HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and provides a declarative, component-based programming model that helps you efficiently develop user interfaces of any complexity.

Laravel is a free and open-source PHP- based web framework for building high-end web applications. It was created by Taylor Otwell and intended for the development of web applications following the model–view–controller (MVC) architectural pattern and based on Symfony. Some of the features of Laravel include modular packaging system with a dedicated dependency manager, different ways for accessing relational databases, utilities that aid in application deployment and maintenance, and its orientation toward syntactic sugar.

Tailwind CSS is a CSS framework that includes a collection of utility classes for quickly building custom interfaces. Tailwind CSS is different from CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap, Bulma, or Foundation, because Tailwind CSS is not a UI Framework.[5] Tailwind CSS has neither a default theme nor built-in UI components. Tailwind CSS is designed to be used by users according to the custom designs they want.

challanges: This project have a pretty complicated payouts feature that i successfully (barely) implement. There is also the multiple roles for user that is essential for this project functionality

projectDetail.detailDesc: the homepage, i make the UI to be simple and straightforward
the Kantin's detail, here are the products that each kantin listed and user can buy
the list of kantin available in the school
this is where the user have their destination for delivery
the user's cart, here they can choose the delivery method and payment method
i use Midtrans payment gateway for the online payment method
user can see their orders info
user can confirm their order after the order is completed
this is the kantin owner or penjual dashboard, they can see the overview for today's transcaction and transaction report
this is kantin management and product management, penjual can edit and add products and their kantin info
this is the ongoing order page, there is also the completed and failed order page
this is the pengantar or delivery person dashboard, they can see the overview for today's transcaction and transaction report
this is the ongoing order page for pengantar, there is also there is also the completed and failed order page
this is the admin dashboard, they can see the overview for today's transaction and payment report
this is the user management page for admin
this is the category management page
this is the roles and permission management page, i use laravel spatie for the roles and permission function

this is the payout page, admin supposed to pay the kantin because of the nature of Midtrans payment gateway, because all the money that is from the transaction will be going to the one admin's designated credit card, admin will have to pay the kantin and pengantar for their money. there is also refund page for the user

projectDesc: Clean Sweep is a web-based app that is built using Laravel and TailwindCSS. This app is something like a small e-commerce for a Cleaning Equipment Store that my friend's parents had.

techStack.techDesc: Laravel is a free and open-source PHP- based web framework for building high-end web applications. It was created by Taylor Otwell and intended for the development of web applications following the model–view–controller (MVC) architectural pattern and based on Symfony. Some of the features of Laravel include modular packaging system with a dedicated dependency manager, different ways for accessing relational databases, utilities that aid in application deployment and maintenance, and its orientation toward syntactic sugar.

Tailwind CSS is a CSS framework that includes a collection of utility classes for quickly building custom interfaces. Tailwind CSS is different from CSS frameworks such as Bootstrap, Bulma, or Foundation, because Tailwind CSS is not a UI Framework.[5] Tailwind CSS has neither a default theme nor built-in UI components. Tailwind CSS is designed to be used by users according to the custom designs they want.

challanges: At that time i was doing my other project too, so i am a bit overwhelmed doing multiple projects at the same time but that gives me the experience of doing something under pressure, and it come out fine.

projectDetail.detailDesc: Homepage, this project UI is more to the simplicity and experience for the user
this products here is the highlight in the homepage
this is the tutorial for purchasing the products
this is the products catalogue, you can browse/search the name and types of products that you want
this is where you add your adresses for shipping, i integrate RajaOngkir api for this
this is where you add your adresses for shipping, i integrate RajaOngkir api for this
this is where your shopping cart is, i use RajaOngkir api for shipping fee calculation
this is where your shopping cart is, i use RajaOngkir api for shipping fee calculation
this is the payment screen, i use Midtrans payment gateway for this
this is where the user can see their transaction history
this is the admin panel for user management
this is the admin panel for products management
this is the admin panel for types management
this is the admin panel for transaction management

projectDesc: This is as its name suggest, a web app that help it's user manage their income/expenses. I make this project from my Nuxt Mastery course.

techStack.techDesc: Nuxt.js is a free and open source web application framework dependent on Vue.js, Node.js, Webpack, and Babel.js. This framework is promoted as a 'meta framework for universal applications'.
Supabase is an open-source alternative to Supabase, built on Postgres..

challanges: A deep-dive project into Nuxt 3, the biggest challange is implementing the new knowledge into practice.
